DOC.brief_summary: This clinical study develop evaluate clinical outcome patient undergo coronary artery bypass graft via Minimally Invasive Coronary Surgery ( MICS ) ; minimally invasive coronary bypass procedure do beat heart via small chest incision , thus avoid invasiveness standard procedure .
DOC.brief_title: Graft Patency Outcomes Patients Undergoing Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting Via Minimally Invasive Coronary Surgery
DOC.criteria: > equal 18 < equal 80 year age Suitable minimally invasive coronary surgery ( MICS ) candidate nonemergent first time , single multivessel coronary artery bypass grafting ( pump pump ) Left ventricle ejection fraction > 30 % Willing able provide write informed consent comply study requirement Severe cerebrovascular disease within 90 day surgery include history prior stroke . Previous cardiac surgery procedure CABG revision , surgical ablation valve replacement Congestive heart failure New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) Class IV History renal insufficiency ( i.e . prior serum creatinine > 2mg/dl ) and/or require dialysis Uncontrolled diabetes ( i.e . > 2 serum glucose concentration > 350 mg/dl ) Severe uncontrolled systemic hypertension ( i.e . systolic pressure > 160 mmHg ) Peripheral/systemic active infection exclude patient cardiac surgery Life expectancy less 1 year due illness cancer pulmonary , hepatic renal disease Participation another investigational protocol may confound result study Female child bear potential lactating intend become pregnant study Severe distal disease small posterior lateral target
